title: The Blind Side Subject Michael Oher Says Family Lied About Adopting Him
description: The former NFL tackle, known from 'The Blind Side,' alleges that Sean and Leigh Anne Tuohy never adopted him

title: Clarence Avant, ‘Godfather of Black Music’ Dies at 92
description: Clarence Avant, known as "The Godfather of Black Music," has died. He was 92.

title: Want to Give Your Life More Meaning? Think of It As a ‘Hero’s Journey’
description: Imagining yourself as the main character of a heroic adventure could help you achieve a more meaningful life.

title: Judge Issues Unprecedented Ruling In Montana Youth Climate Trial
description: The judge sided with young environmental activists who said state agencies violated their right to a clean and healthy environment.

title: The Best Photos from the Iowa State Fair
description: From presidential candidates to cattle to butter sculptures.

title: Trials Are About Facts. That’s Bad For Trump.
description: Courtrooms don't run like TV shows and that may prove the undoing of Donald Trump.

title: Pakistan’s Caretaker Prime Minister Sworn in
description: Former Sentaor Anwaar-ul-Haq Kakar will head Pakistan's caretaker government that will oversee parliamentary elections.

title: Zuckerberg Says ‘Time to Move on’ From Musk Cage Fight
description: Mark Zuckerberg said in a Threads post that it's "time to move on” from speculation about a cage fight match between him and Elon Musk.

title: Far-Right Populist Javier Milei Wins Argentina’s Presidential Primary Election
description: Far-right populist Javier Milei emerged as the biggest vote-getter in Argentina's presidential primary elections ahead of October's general election.

title: Niger’s Coup Leaders Say They Will Prosecute President Mohamed Bazoum for ‘High Treason’
description: Deposed President Mohamed Bazoum faces prosecution from Niger's junta amid growing international pressure to reinstate him.

title: House Republicans Want Joe Biden to Testify Before Congress. Do Presidents Do That?
description: Some suspect House Republicans hope to use Biden's refusal to testify as grounds for impeachment.

title: She Wasn’t Able to Get an Abortion. Now She’s a Mom. Soon She’ll Start 7th Grade.
description: After the fall of Roe v. Wade, some travel hundreds of miles to get an abortion. This is the story of a girl who couldn't.

title: Maui Officials and Scientists Warn Toxic Particles Will Remain After Wildfires
description: Hawaii’s state toxicologist Diana Felton said that it could take weeks or months to clean up the pollutants.

title: Israel’s Existential Crisis
description: Within months, Israel could find itself living in a different political world. Now is the moment of truth

title: After More Than Three Years, New Zealand Finally Lifts All COVID-19 Restrictions
description: Prime Minister Chris Hipkins said the requirement to wear masks in hospitals and other healthcare facilities would end at midnight, as would a requirement for people who caught the virus to isolate themselves for seven days.

title: Hong Kong Court Partially Quashes Convictions of Prominent Democracy Activists
description: The charges involved a rally in August 2019 that drew an estimated 1.7 million people onto Hong Kong's streets to call for greater police accountability and democracy.

title: Ecuadorian Journalist to Take Assassinated Candidate’s Place on Presidential Ticket
description: The party of assassinated Ecuadorian presidential candidate Fernando Villavicencio has chosen a friend and close associate of his to run in the nation’s convulsed elections.
